commit_message:
Decouple L3 and VPN service plugins during router operations

This change leverages the event registry to decouple L3 and VPN
when checking whether certain router operations can be permitted
or not. Patch [1] has the required changes to clean up the Neutron
side.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/153776/

Related-blueprint: services-split
Related-blueprint: plugin-interface-perestroika

Change-Id: I6ac366b329466df6c79a3683e6374feca76773a0

commit_message:
Use bind-mounted directory for tempest logs

In an effort to improve the artifacts we have from the gate, make
tempest record its logs in the utility container's bind-mounted log
directory. The gate publisher will then automatically copy the file.

Conflicts:
	rpc_deployment/roles/tempest/templates/tempest.conf.j2

Related-bug: 1425482
Change-Id: I5811c2d34772ef4711d9c483038edb5a5c1a6897
(cherry picked from commit 1f09957c23dd6e11b15648a9eec873b0fa925f6e)

subject: Add flat network gateway to br-vlan for AIO builds
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-05 18:33:13.000000000', 'files': ['etc/network/interfaces.d/aio_interfaces.cfg'], 'message': 'Add flat network gateway to br-vlan for AIO builds

When an AIO is built using the included scripts and networking config,
the public network has a gateway IP of 172.29.248.1 from the
172.29.248.0/22 network, which is not expected or configured to exist
anywhere. This can cause issues when using floats or in general if
some communication is desired which uses the public side gateway of
the neutron-routed network.

A simple solution is to simply drop 172.29.248.1/22 on br-vlan via the
interface config, which allows the traffic to do the needful, at least
as far as tempest's requirements are concerned. In modern
Debian/Ubuntu, this can be accomplished with another "iface" stanza
with its own "address" directive to add the additional address.

Conflicts:
	etc/network/interfaces.d/aio_interfaces.cfg

Change-Id: I79897bc4e4d7eb7d55ad3c12f55a339dfef869e1
Closes-Bug: #1425717
Related-Bug: #1425255
(cherry picked from commit 0737a6062c2e1c96706bd0289c652dc3802802c2)
'}]
commit_message:
Add flat network gateway to br-vlan for AIO builds

When an AIO is built using the included scripts and networking config,
the public network has a gateway IP of 172.29.248.1 from the
172.29.248.0/22 network, which is not expected or configured to exist
anywhere. This can cause issues when using floats or in general if
some communication is desired which uses the public side gateway of
the neutron-routed network.

A simple solution is to simply drop 172.29.248.1/22 on br-vlan via the
interface config, which allows the traffic to do the needful, at least
as far as tempest's requirements are concerned. In modern
Debian/Ubuntu, this can be accomplished with another "iface" stanza
with its own "address" directive to add the additional address.

Conflicts:
	etc/network/interfaces.d/aio_interfaces.cfg

Change-Id: I79897bc4e4d7eb7d55ad3c12f55a339dfef869e1
Closes-Bug: #1425717
Related-Bug: #1425255
(cherry picked from commit 0737a6062c2e1c96706bd0289c652dc3802802c2)

subject: devstack/install.sh shouldn't rely on exact paths
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-05 15:16:35.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/devstack/install.sh'], 'message': "devstack/install.sh shouldn't rely on exact paths

Currently the contrib/devstack/install.sh script relies on the fact that
designate and devstack are installed side by side. This isn't always
true and can restrict the developer if he keeps his code someplace else
on the filesystem. This patch proposes a change to install.sh which
stores the pwd (where the script assumes devstack is installed,
according to the installation documentation [1]) and uses that directory
instead.

[1]: https://designate.readthedocs.org/en/latest/devstack.html

Change-Id: I97f7762dde56df6e3b9a45198d9201ec0296d94f
Closes-Bug: 1428679
"}]
commit_message:
devstack/install.sh shouldn't rely on exact paths

Currently the contrib/devstack/install.sh script relies on the fact that
designate and devstack are installed side by side. This isn't always
true and can restrict the developer if he keeps his code someplace else
on the filesystem. This patch proposes a change to install.sh which
stores the pwd (where the script assumes devstack is installed,
according to the installation documentation [1]) and uses that directory
instead.

[1]: https://designate.readthedocs.org/en/latest/devstack.html

Change-Id: I97f7762dde56df6e3b9a45198d9201ec0296d94f
Closes-Bug: 1428679

commit_message:
Updated help on cinder reset-state cli

These were missing in cinder help for reset-state cli. I have added
these in help.

commit_message:
Fix jenkins name and floating ip

The jenkins name was accidentally checked in with a test value
and floating ips were not handled correctly.  HPCS was previously
running an older API and I didn't notice until they upgraded
that it was not consistent with devstack.

Change-Id: Ib858726f4ae86ba988bb8c91032b278e08a69c9f

commit_message:
Fix missing parameters for Neutron security group API

1. Query parameters
   Add query parameters for Show/List API.
2. Security Group Rule
   Add some parameters about Security group rule for Show/List/Create API.
3. tenant_id
   Add tenant_id parameter for Show/List/Create API.

Change-Id: Iac9ecf0391a2d4a6713ee337896c2e5ed30607bf
Closes-Bug: #1425337

commit_message:
Puppet: First support Ceph

This is a first implementation of Ceph support in TripleO with Puppet:

* Install ceph-mon on controller node
* Install ceph-osd on cephstorage node

Co-Authored-By: Giulio Fidente <gfidente@redhat.com>

Change-Id: I48488cbe950047fae5e746e458106d6edb9a6183

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2015-03-05 20:45:31.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'test-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Add oslo.vmware to store requirements

VMware store backend requires oslo.vmware but its not in
requirements. Its currently satisfied by the dependency from
glance project. While the tests are satisfied by the explicit
dependency in test-requirements.

This change adds oslo.vmware to requirements and removes from

Change-Id: I149cc0b5ccb872cfad24a56bca578fb372a4703e

commit_message:
Add oslo.vmware to store requirements

VMware store backend requires oslo.vmware but its not in
requirements. Its currently satisfied by the dependency from
glance project. While the tests are satisfied by the explicit
dependency in test-requirements.

This change adds oslo.vmware to requirements and removes from
test-requirements.

commit_message:
Create _member_ role in keystone bootstrap

The _member_ role must be created because horizon uses this as the default role
to add to users in projects. Unfortunately because we need to add the role id
to the CONF file we have to create this role, insert it into the config file
and then restart keystone to have the change take effect.

This is a similar process as what needs to happen with defining administration
domain_ids for policy so create a function that can be used to bootstrap
keystone with these sort of database/config file synchronized values.

Change-Id: I65738b4f52e750abfc34995e2d618f9b1c57e5b3
Closes-Bug: #1421616

commit_message:
Ensure context is cleared before running context tests

Some other tests call get_admin_context() at import time, which
implicitly registers a context. We should rethink the use of
side-effects like this because it can cause unexpected behavior.
However, this is the easiest short-term workaround.

Change-Id: I5a6e0db04a8c90fe3bb90c21ed4b9d7afb016bdc
Partial-bug: 1428728

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-03-04 19:36:50.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/utils.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Allow disabling the evacuate cleanup mechanism in compute manager

This mechanism attempts to destroy any locally-running instances on
startup if instance.host != self.host. The assumption is that the
instance has been evacuated and is safely running elsewhere. This is
a dangerous assumption to make, so this patch adds a configuration
variable to disable this behavior if it's not desired.

Note that disabling it may have implications for the case where
instances *were* evacuated, given potential shared resources.
To counter that problem, this patch also makes _init_instance()
skip initialization of the instance if it appears to be owned
by another host, logging a prominent warning in that case.

As a result, if you have destroy_after_evacuate=False and you start
a nova compute with an incorrect hostname, or run it twice from
another host, then the worst that will happen is you get log
warnings about the instances on the host being ignored. This should
be an indication that something is wrong, but still allow for
fixing it without any loss. If the configuration option is disabled
and a legitimate evacuation does occur, simply enabling it and then
restarting the compute service will cause the cleanup to occur.

This is added to the workarounds config group because it is really
only relevant while evacuate is fundamentally broken in this way.
It needs to be refactored to be more robust, and once that is done,
this should be able to go away.

DocImpact: New configuration option, and peril warning
Partial-Bug: #1419785
Change-Id: Ib9a3c72c096822dd5c65c905117ae14994c73e99
"}]
commit_message:
Allow disabling the evacuate cleanup mechanism in compute manager

This mechanism attempts to destroy any locally-running instances on
startup if instance.host != self.host. The assumption is that the
instance has been evacuated and is safely running elsewhere. This is
a dangerous assumption to make, so this patch adds a configuration
variable to disable this behavior if it's not desired.

Note that disabling it may have implications for the case where
instances *were* evacuated, given potential shared resources.
To counter that problem, this patch also makes _init_instance()
skip initialization of the instance if it appears to be owned
by another host, logging a prominent warning in that case.

As a result, if you have destroy_after_evacuate=False and you start
a nova compute with an incorrect hostname, or run it twice from
another host, then the worst that will happen is you get log
warnings about the instances on the host being ignored. This should
be an indication that something is wrong, but still allow for
fixing it without any loss. If the configuration option is disabled
and a legitimate evacuation does occur, simply enabling it and then
restarting the compute service will cause the cleanup to occur.

This is added to the workarounds config group because it is really
only relevant while evacuate is fundamentally broken in this way.
It needs to be refactored to be more robust, and once that is done,
this should be able to go away.

DocImpact: New configuration option, and peril warning
Partial-Bug: #1419785
Change-Id: Ib9a3c72c096822dd5c65c905117ae14994c73e99

subject: Add a stopwatch + split for duration(s)
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-03-04 20:47:04.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_utils/timeutils.py', 'oslo_utils/tests/test_timeutils.py'], 'message': "Add a stopwatch + split for duration(s)

The existing timeutils provides a way to measure durations
that is also used to get actual times and dates; for most
cases this dual ability is not needed and the user only cares
about the duration between two time points. In cases where
ntpd may affect the machine clock this usage is also incorrect
and may go backwards in time...

To support this kind of specific and frequently occurring usage
a stopwatch class can be used that can enable more accurate
gathering of *just* durations (and using monotonic time when
it's available in python 3.3+ or optionally when the library
at http://pypi.python.org/pypi/monotonic is installed).

This code comes from taskflow, but oslo.messaging has similar
code that they could replace with this (and I imagine tooz
could also use this); among others...

Change-Id: I950e26c1eb8283a134fb4f16544f87bc5d29fd82
"}]
commit_message:
Add a stopwatch + split for duration(s)

The existing timeutils provides a way to measure durations
that is also used to get actual times and dates; for most
cases this dual ability is not needed and the user only cares
about the duration between two time points. In cases where
ntpd may affect the machine clock this usage is also incorrect
and may go backwards in time...

To support this kind of specific and frequently occurring usage
a stopwatch class can be used that can enable more accurate
gathering of *just* durations (and using monotonic time when
it's available in python 3.3+ or optionally when the library
at http://pypi.python.org/pypi/monotonic is installed).

This code comes from taskflow, but oslo.messaging has similar
code that they could replace with this (and I imagine tooz
could also use this); among others...

Change-Id: I950e26c1eb8283a134fb4f16544f87bc5d29fd82

commit_message:
Add Puppet 4.x lint checks

- This changes the puppet-lint requirement to 1.1.x, so that we can use
  puppet-lint plugins. Most of these plugins are for 4.x compat, but some just
  catch common errors.

Change-Id: Ie7e1f8b4d4cdd5d058b95cdf2c29c80dc73b954c
Signed-off-by: Gael Chamoulaud <gchamoul@redhat.com>

subject: Fix a minor coding nit in Fernet testing
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-04 01:54:00.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/token/test_fernet_provider.py'], 'message': 'Fix a minor coding nit in Fernet testing

Before, we were wrapping UUID strings in curly braces. This was because the
Fernet implementation did this when converting uuid.hex strings to bytes. The
implementation has since been refactored to be simpiler. This should follow
suit.

Change-Id: Ie7f35ab2955a4dcc03b8d350224692b65045f70f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a minor coding nit in Fernet testing

Before, we were wrapping UUID strings in curly braces. This was because the
Fernet implementation did this when converting uuid.hex strings to bytes. The
implementation has since been refactored to be simpiler. This should follow
suit.

Change-Id: Ie7f35ab2955a4dcc03b8d350224692b65045f70f

commit_message:
Replaces hardcoded volume size by configured value

The volume_create methods used a hardcoded volume_size of 1GB. The
configured volume_size wasn't used on each place. If one used a 
configured image_ref with a volume_size > 1GB this would result in an
error.
This patch replaces all occurrences of the hardcoded volume_size by
the configured value.

Closes-Bug: 1289118
Change-Id: I99cf80e4078eec6a5021793b664b6cfcf02d2988

subject: Catch AttributeError in header with no alias
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-05 20:56:50.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/resource.py', 'openstack/tests/test_resource.py'], 'message': "Catch AttributeError in header with no alias

Now that resource.header is a thing and it's populated with the headers
from a requests.Response, which is a
requests.structures.CaseInsensitiveDict, we have to take an extra step
to make sure we don't try and convert a None-alias to lower case.

Change-Id: I47704191d1822d468389986c5ab203781af59074
Closes-Bug: 1428342
"}]
commit_message:
Catch AttributeError in header with no alias

Now that resource.header is a thing and it's populated with the headers
from a requests.Response, which is a
requests.structures.CaseInsensitiveDict, we have to take an extra step
to make sure we don't try and convert a None-alias to lower case.

Change-Id: I47704191d1822d468389986c5ab203781af59074
Closes-Bug: 1428342

commit_message:
Enables Swift backup driver for auth 2.0

This patch adds support for Swift auth 2.0 to the
 cinder-backup Swift driver.

I've noticed that the changes have been automatically
 made in the following sources:
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/section_cinder.conf.html
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/cinder-conf-changes-juno.html
http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/config-reference/content/section_volume-misc.html

except for the one in this patch.

Change-Id: If72f718a2757f8f0cd3563bfa8d6bdae4fc81b8b
Closes-Bug: #1355475

subject: Flesh out api version defaults
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-05 16:19:04.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py', 'os_client_config/defaults.py', 'os_client_config/vendors.py'], 'message': 'Flesh out api version defaults

openstackclient needs a bit richer support for api version defaults.
Namely, it knows what defaults it wants to have - but we need to do
defaults processing in os-client-config to get sequencing correct. So
provide an API call to set new defaults that can be used before config
processing. Also, flesh out the dict of known default values with good
defaults to match osc behavior, and add the known v1 default of HP to
the vendors.py values.

Change-Id: I45e2550af58aee616ca168d20a557077beeab007
'}]
commit_message:
Flesh out api version defaults

openstackclient needs a bit richer support for api version defaults.
Namely, it knows what defaults it wants to have - but we need to do
defaults processing in os-client-config to get sequencing correct. So
provide an API call to set new defaults that can be used before config
processing. Also, flesh out the dict of known default values with good
defaults to match osc behavior, and add the known v1 default of HP to
the vendors.py values.

Change-Id: I45e2550af58aee616ca168d20a557077beeab007

subject: Rename --verify for server resize to avoid conflict
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-16 03:12:38.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/command-objects/server.rst', 'openstackclient/tests/compute/v2/test_server.py', 'openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'message': 'Rename --verify for server resize to avoid conflict

Currently server resize command has a verify argument for user to
confirm resize operation. But this argument is also registered by
openstack client shell which is used to enable server certificate
verification. So verify argument can not be correctly passed to
server resize command.

This patch renames --verify to --confirm (nova client has a
resize-confirm command) to solve this problem.

Change-Id: I751aa3df16c3b637b82944dd350afc5cbab62120
Closes-Bug: #1416542
'}]
commit_message:
Rename --verify for server resize to avoid conflict

Currently server resize command has a verify argument for user to
confirm resize operation. But this argument is also registered by
openstack client shell which is used to enable server certificate
verification. So verify argument can not be correctly passed to
server resize command.

This patch renames --verify to --confirm (nova client has a
resize-confirm command) to solve this problem.

Change-Id: I751aa3df16c3b637b82944dd350afc5cbab62120
Closes-Bug: #1416542

commit_message:
DHCP should be disabled on external subnet

External network should have dhcp option disabled. But the test
use base create_subnet option which have dhcp enabled by default.
We should pass enable_dhcp=False keyword argument explicitly to
create_subnet for external networks.

Change-Id: Ife13f8b0a890184d26bb941faec84dcc496c90b4
Closes-bug: #1420048

commit_message:
Remove rubick and milk-dev from gerritbot

These two channels are not setup properly, openstackinfra has no access
to them, milk-dev is not even a registered channel.
The projects are also dead, there has not been any change for them for
several months (last merge in rubick: 2014-06-18, milk: 2014-03-13).

Thus, remove the channels from gerritbot.

Change-Id: I848e36c24797518805cf1e5492a7fec8111cc690

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-10 10:41:28.000000000', 'files': ['nova/wsgi.py', 'nova/tests/test_wsgi.py'], 'message': "Eventlet green threads not released back to pool

Presently, the wsgi server allows persist connections hence even after
the response is sent to the client, it doesn't close the client socket
connection.
Because of this problem, the green thread is not released back to the pool.

In order to close the client socket connection explicitly after the
response is sent and read successfully by the client, you simply have to
set keepalive to False when you create a wsgi server.

Add a parameter to take advantage of the new(ish) eventlet socket timeout
behaviour. Allows closing idle client connections after a period of
time, eg:

$ time nc localhost 8776
real    1m0.063s

Setting 'client_socket_timeout = 0' means do not timeout.

DocImpact:
Added wsgi_keep_alive option (default=True).
Added client_socket_timeout option (default=0).

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/test_wsgi.py

Note: The required unit-tests are manually added to the below path,
as new path for unit-tests is not present in stable/icehouse release.
nova/tests/compute/test_host_api.py

This patch is not 1:1 cherry-pick, I have changed the default value
of client_socket_timeout to 0, as per the policy for changes to
stable branches.
(https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/StableBranch#Appropriate_Fixes)

SecurityImpact

Closes-Bug: #1361360
Change-Id: I399b812f6d452226fd306c423de8dcea8520d2aa
(cherry picked from commit 04d7a724fdf80db51e73f12c5b8c982db9310742)
"}]
commit_message:
Eventlet green threads not released back to pool

Presently, the wsgi server allows persist connections hence even after
the response is sent to the client, it doesn't close the client socket
connection.
Because of this problem, the green thread is not released back to the pool.

In order to close the client socket connection explicitly after the
response is sent and read successfully by the client, you simply have to
set keepalive to False when you create a wsgi server.

Add a parameter to take advantage of the new(ish) eventlet socket timeout
behaviour. Allows closing idle client connections after a period of
time, eg:

$ time nc localhost 8776
real    1m0.063s

Setting 'client_socket_timeout = 0' means do not timeout.

DocImpact:
Added wsgi_keep_alive option (default=True).
Added client_socket_timeout option (default=0).

Conflicts:
        nova/tests/unit/test_wsgi.py

Note: The required unit-tests are manually added to the below path,
as new path for unit-tests is not present in stable/icehouse release.
nova/tests/compute/test_host_api.py

This patch is not 1:1 cherry-pick, I have changed the default value
of client_socket_timeout to 0, as per the policy for changes to
stable branches.
(https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/StableBranch#Appropriate_Fixes)

SecurityImpact

Closes-Bug: #1361360
Change-Id: I399b812f6d452226fd306c423de8dcea8520d2aa

With the recent refactoring in Neutron, the router creation logic has
changed. This modifies the VPNaaS repo unit tests to be compatible
with these changes. Reference review 147744, which is approved and
awaiting merge.

Note: There were two tests which were testing DVR, but were calling
a router vs a DVR. Didn't seem to affect the test done, however, but

Closes-Bug: #1427858

commit_message:
VPNaaS: Fix unit test breakage

With the recent refactoring in Neutron, the router creation logic has
changed. This modifies the VPNaaS repo unit tests to be compatible
with these changes. Reference review 147744, which is approved and
awaiting merge.

Note: There were two tests which were testing DVR, but were calling
a router vs a DVR. Didn't seem to affect the test done, however, but
fixed.

Change-Id: Ic310a323462e02a9b1b8989122e7b20444402d1a
Closes-Bug: #1427858

commit_message:
Refactor DVR _arp_entry methods

This should decouple the DVR stuff from the agent.  This moves some
methods to dvr_router to encapulate them better.  It removes a
reference to fullsync from DVR to better separate concerns.

Change-Id: Ibf0cec4c44576f7c7196c9780a1b12de96a812b3
Partially-Implements: bp/restructure-l3-agent

commit_message:
Set Tempest authentication endpoints to global default

This change removes redundant concatenation by replacing the endpoints
with ones pre-defined as global variables.

This also allows the endpoint to be overwritten if necessary.

Closes-Bug: #1424729

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-11-09 06:33:49.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron', 'lib/keystone'], 'message': 'Make config files created by stask.sh more secure

Bugfix 1257599. stack.sh used to leave config files with keystone token
and database credentials readable for all. This change makes sure that
all below files have 640 permissions:
    /etc/keystone/keystone.conf
    /etc/nova/nova.conf
    /etc/heat/heat.conf
    /etc/cinder/cinder.conf
    /etc/glance/{glance-api.conf,glance-api-paste.ini,glance-registry.conf}
    /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf
    /etc/neutron/neutron.conf
Additionally set the same permissions for /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf which
contains XenServer xapi credentials.

Change-Id: I9f8b703aa7e4f064656141a548bff014be500daf
'}]
commit_message:
Make config files created by stask.sh more secure

Bugfix 1257599. stack.sh used to leave config files with keystone token
and database credentials readable for all. This change makes sure that
all below files have 640 permissions:
    /etc/keystone/keystone.conf
    /etc/nova/nova.conf
    /etc/heat/heat.conf
    /etc/cinder/cinder.conf
    /etc/glance/{glance-api.conf,glance-api-paste.ini,glance-registry.conf}
    /etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf
    /etc/neutron/neutron.conf
Additionally set the same permissions for /etc/neutron/rootwrap.conf which
contains XenServer xapi credentials.

Change-Id: I9f8b703aa7e4f064656141a548bff014be500daf

subject: ensure we reset contexts when fixture is used
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-05 17:12:32.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_context/fixture.py', 'oslo_context/tests/test_fixture.py'], 'message': 'ensure we reset contexts when fixture is used

Previously using the ClearRequestContext fixture only reset contexts
on fixture teardown. If *all* tests in a test suite use this fixture,
this is fine. However if any tests do not, it means you might start
with a carry over context from previous tests.

Using this fixture means you really wanted a clean slate, so fix it so
that you get a clean state when you get started as well as when you
finish.

Change-Id: I5e6f7bc2866fe66f269c7d5e1f36c711151489c2
Closes-Bug: #1428728
'}]
commit_message:
ensure we reset contexts when fixture is used

Previously using the ClearRequestContext fixture only reset contexts
on fixture teardown. If *all* tests in a test suite use this fixture,
this is fine. However if any tests do not, it means you might start
with a carry over context from previous tests.

Using this fixture means you really wanted a clean slate, so fix it so
that you get a clean state when you get started as well as when you
finish.

Change-Id: I5e6f7bc2866fe66f269c7d5e1f36c711151489c2
Closes-Bug: #1428728

commit_message:
Fixed pool and health monitor create bugs

lbaas-pool-create now accepts --name as an optional argument and no longer lists
healthmonitor_id as an acceptable argument.  lbaas-create-healthmonitor
now accepts --pool as an argument so a healthmonitor can be added
to a pool.

Change-Id: I7c5ae61a5278119bf5c3999f4b295bd8a291d777
Closes-Bug: #1426246
Closes-Bug: #1426253

subject: Add mako templating plugin and XSS profile
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-03-05 16:44:06.000000000', 'files': ['bandit/plugins/mako_templates.py', '.gitignore', 'examples/mako_templating.py', 'bandit/plugins/jinja2_templates.py', 'tests/test_functional.py', 'bandit.yaml'], 'message': "Add mako templating plugin and XSS profile

Adds plugin to warn on Mako templates. Since mako does not have template wide
autoescaping (that we can verify is turned on), a developer is responsible to
escape each variable individually in the templates. This is higher than info
because the *only* way to escape is via the variables, but not set to ERROR
because we can't know for sure if any of those variables are used and/or
malicious.

Also add an XSS profile.

Change-Id: I65515f9584d67d8b7b58b71b6ddb447c307675d1
"}]
commit_message:
Add mako templating plugin and XSS profile

Adds plugin to warn on Mako templates. Since mako does not have template wide
autoescaping (that we can verify is turned on), a developer is responsible to
escape each variable individually in the templates. This is higher than info
because the *only* way to escape is via the variables, but not set to ERROR
because we can't know for sure if any of those variables are used and/or
malicious.

Also add an XSS profile.

Change-Id: I65515f9584d67d8b7b58b71b6ddb447c307675d1

commit_message:
Set headers on object before creating/updating

We're not currently sending on headers from Object.create, so while we
can create objects, we can't set metadata key/value pairs on them at the
same time. Adding a set headers solves this.

Change-Id: Ie3bbebbdcff32152c0f433257606844ff1120ef8

commit_message:
Allow providing a logger to save_and_reraise_exception

Instead of always assuming the best logger to use when
a exception is being dropped is the root logger (which
it may not always be) allow for providing a custom
logger when using this functionality + class so that
users can direct it to a logger of there choosing.

Change-Id: Ic56892be9d007229f5c302a2c6da19f00e91752e

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-03-05 16:31:35.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_policy/opts.py'], 'message': "deprecate policy_dirs option

It is not clear why this is a configurable option. The original
blueprint just wanted the ability to specify a policy.d infrastructure
to make complex policies easier to enforce. There was no requirement
on it being configurable.

Being configurable just exposes another way in which incompatibilities
in OpenStack projects might be able to emerge. As this merged late in
the incubator lifecycle for the policy code, there are likely few/no
existing users of the option so it should be safe to deprecate it
for the library.  That way we won't break anyone currently using it,
and don't have to commit to supporting it going forward.

Co-Authored-By: Steve Martinelli <stevemar@ca.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I40bcbfbd4ab626fa9bfa050792e9ed3cfb587225
"}]
commit_message:
deprecate policy_dirs option

It is not clear why this is a configurable option. The original
blueprint just wanted the ability to specify a policy.d infrastructure
to make complex policies easier to enforce. There was no requirement
on it being configurable.

Being configurable just exposes another way in which incompatibilities
in OpenStack projects might be able to emerge. As this merged late in
the incubator lifecycle for the policy code, there are likely few/no
existing users of the option so it should be safe to deprecate it
for the library.  That way we won't break anyone currently using it,
and don't have to commit to supporting it going forward.

Co-Authored-By: Steve Martinelli <stevemar@ca.ibm.com>
Change-Id: I40bcbfbd4ab626fa9bfa050792e9ed3cfb587225

subject: Add flat network gateway to br-vlan for AIO builds
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-05 16:49:50.000000000', 'files': ['etc/network/interfaces.d/aio_interfaces.cfg'], 'message': 'Add flat network gateway to br-vlan for AIO builds

When an AIO is built using the included scripts and networking config,
the public network has a gateway IP of 172.29.248.1 from the
172.29.248.0/22 network, which is not expected or configured to exist
anywhere. This can cause issues when using floats or in general if
some communication is desired which uses the public side gateway of
the neutron-routed network.

A simple solution is to simply drop 172.29.248.1/22 on br-vlan via the
interface config, which allows the traffic to do the needful, at least
as far as tempest's requirements are concerned. In modern
Debian/Ubuntu, this can be accomplished with another "iface" stanza
with its own "address" directive to add the additional address.

Change-Id: I79897bc4e4d7eb7d55ad3c12f55a339dfef869e1
Closes-Bug: #1425717
Related-Bug: #1425255
(cherry picked from commit 0737a6062c2e1c96706bd0289c652dc3802802c2)

Conflicts:
	etc/network/interfaces.d/aio_interfaces.cfg

Change-Id: Ie1f9829e3b3cc494f2c5d178013513f276b88a8b
'}]
commit_message:
Add flat network gateway to br-vlan for AIO builds

When an AIO is built using the included scripts and networking config,
the public network has a gateway IP of 172.29.248.1 from the
172.29.248.0/22 network, which is not expected or configured to exist
anywhere. This can cause issues when using floats or in general if
some communication is desired which uses the public side gateway of
the neutron-routed network.

A simple solution is to simply drop 172.29.248.1/22 on br-vlan via the
interface config, which allows the traffic to do the needful, at least
as far as tempest's requirements are concerned. In modern
Debian/Ubuntu, this can be accomplished with another "iface" stanza
with its own "address" directive to add the additional address.

Change-Id: I79897bc4e4d7eb7d55ad3c12f55a339dfef869e1
Closes-Bug: #1425717
Related-Bug: #1425255
(cherry picked from commit 0737a6062c2e1c96706bd0289c652dc3802802c2)

Conflicts:
	etc/network/interfaces.d/aio_interfaces.cfg

Change-Id: Ie1f9829e3b3cc494f2c5d178013513f276b88a8b

commit_message:
Add flat network gateway to br-vlan for AIO builds

When an AIO is built using the included scripts and networking config,
the public network has a gateway IP of 172.29.248.1 from the
172.29.248.0/22 network, which is not expected or configured to exist
anywhere. This can cause issues when using floats or in general if
some communication is desired which uses the public side gateway of
the neutron-routed network.

A simple solution is to simply drop 172.29.248.1/22 on br-vlan via the
interface config, which allows the traffic to do the needful, at least
as far as tempest's requirements are concerned. In modern
Debian/Ubuntu, this can be accomplished with another "iface" stanza
with its own "address" directive to add the additional address.

Change-Id: I79897bc4e4d7eb7d55ad3c12f55a339dfef869e1
Closes-Bug: #1425717
Related-Bug: #1425255
(cherry picked from commit 0737a6062c2e1c96706bd0289c652dc3802802c2)

Conflicts:
	etc/network/interfaces.d/aio_interfaces.cfg

Change-Id: Icb01730c5e08d9e3722445bbac0c11eb5ff6f17d

commit_message:
Allow DB API to connect to arbitrary database for cellsv2

This patch allows the SQLAlchemy DB API to talk to any arbitrary
database. It allows augmenting existing request context with the connection
information of the target database and the uses the augmented context to
instantiate the SQLAlchemy engine/session objects.
If the default unaugmented context is used, the DB API connects to the database
specified in the configuration file.

Change-Id: Iee3932ece4a00ca46f8508d41c130b9061bee818

Creates classes representing the 3 types of namespaces handled by the L3 agent:
router, snat and fip.

The scope of this change is:

- Creation and deletion methods are provided for each namespace class
- Creation and deletion of router and snat namespaces are moved to the router
  classes. These namespaces are now members of the corresponding router class
- Invocation of Fip namespace creation and deletion is left in the agent, since
  the agent owns it
- A context manager is provided to move the namespaces (router and snat)
  cleanup code out of the agent

A follow up patchset will add methods to create and delete interfaces in the
namespaces. These methods are intended to be used by the router classes

Change-Id: I54b14e593ded6b2990d57a3ae9d598a699ae133e
Partially-Implements: bp restructure-l3-agent
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor management of namespaces in the L3 Agent

Creates classes representing the 3 types of namespaces handled by the L3 agent:
router, snat and fip.

The scope of this change is:

- Creation and deletion methods are provided for each namespace class
- Creation and deletion of router and snat namespaces are moved to the router
  classes. These namespaces are now members of the corresponding router class
- Invocation of Fip namespace creation and deletion is left in the agent, since
  the agent owns it
- A context manager is provided to move the namespaces (router and snat)
  cleanup code out of the agent

A follow up patchset will add methods to create and delete interfaces in the
namespaces. These methods are intended to be used by the router classes

Change-Id: I54b14e593ded6b2990d57a3ae9d598a699ae133e
Partially-Implements: bp restructure-l3-agent

commit_message:
Service Class Cleanup - Part 1/3

Here, we rework the various Service base classes to have a standard
constructor format, in preperation for turning the RPC/DNS/WSGI
Service classes into mixins, allowing for MiniDNS to be both a
RPC and DNS Service - sharing code with Central etc (RPCService) and
the Agent (DNSService).

Part two will turn each Service sub-class into a mixin.
Part three will move MiniDNS to using the DNSService mixin.

Change-Id: I1647f2036232d1bedfa3b3f79837dc0c808a2700

have the documentation in this repository. Further commits will be
made updating the contents.

This prevents issues where the playbooks fail and the script exits early

commit_message:
Symlink the log directory earlier

This prevents issues where the playbooks fail and the script exits early
and the link is never created. If we create the link after bootstrapping
the AIO, then the logs will be published regardless if the success of
the playbooks.

Closes-bug: 1428744
Change-Id: If30d287e793a8b4bf8c17634a21dfa8e4203d21e

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-30 18:30:36.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Add semantic_version to global-requirements

Glance is adding support of Artifacts - discoverable and reusable
data assets consumable by other Openstack services. Artifacts have
versions as one of user-supplied metadata fields.
According to specification [1] these versions should comply with
semver notation [2].

semantic_version [3] is the most convenient library which implements
semver specification on Python, is python-3 compatible, is
distributed under the two-clause BSD licence.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100968/

[3] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/semantic_version

Change-Id: I74c00625634f246a96a1a9db4e6ff4335e649404
'}]
commit_message:
Add semantic_version to global-requirements

Glance is adding support of Artifacts - discoverable and reusable
data assets consumable by other Openstack services. Artifacts have
versions as one of user-supplied metadata fields.
According to specification [1] these versions should comply with
semver notation [2].

semantic_version [3] is the most convenient library which implements
semver specification on Python, is python-3 compatible, is
distributed under the two-clause BSD licence.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100968/
[2] http://www.semver.org/
[3] https://pypi.python.org/pypi/semantic_version

Change-Id: I74c00625634f246a96a1a9db4e6ff4335e649404

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-03 19:59:41.000000000', 'files': ['glance_store/_drivers/swift/store.py', 'tests/unit/test_swift_store.py'], 'message': "Support for deleting images stored as SLO in Swift

When an image is deleted, the image data is not being deleted
completely if it is stored as static large object(SLO). Only the
manifest is deleted leaving behind all the segments. This leads to
stale data in swift cluster.

This change attempts to delete the SLO in the following way:
 1. Identify a SLO with 'x-static-large-object' header on an object
 2. Delete the SLO, both manifest and the segments, using the
 query string 'multipart-manifest=delete' while deleting the object

Closes-Bug: 1425617

Change-Id: Id2cd3b63ca88d66c5e7435b528ba75fa3c2cbb1c
"}]
commit_message:
Support for deleting images stored as SLO in Swift

When an image is deleted, the image data is not being deleted
completely if it is stored as static large object(SLO). Only the
manifest is deleted leaving behind all the segments. This leads to
stale data in swift cluster.

This change attempts to delete the SLO in the following way:
 1. Identify a SLO with 'x-static-large-object' header on an object
 2. Delete the SLO, both manifest and the segments, using the
 query string 'multipart-manifest=delete' while deleting the object

Closes-Bug: 1425617

Change-Id: Id2cd3b63ca88d66c5e7435b528ba75fa3c2cbb1c

commit_message:
Update tests to use Object.from_dict() method

Updates all tests to use the new Object.from_dict() method,
ensuring all nested resources are correctly built into objects
after the raw dictonary is retrieved from the fixtures.

The API probably got an old system metadata when it
was invoked. This patch populates the system-metadata again
when it is doing the work.

It is trying to fix the bug 1323658, where the network NIC
is missing when we are doing instance resize, migration or something.

commit_message:
Build instance to populate current system_metadata

The API probably got an old system metadata when it
was invoked. This patch populates the system-metadata again
when it is doing the work.

It is trying to fix the bug 1323658, where the network NIC
is missing when we are doing instance resize, migration or something.

Change-Id: I245e017348728a03897f211d307b12484f606e61
Closes-Bug: 1323658

commit_message:
Make the LDAP dependency clear between identity, resource & assignment

We currently hint at the fact that there is dependency on LDAP for
identity if we are using it for resource and/or assignment, but we
don't make it clear enough. This patch fixes this.

Change-Id: Ic6cbffbcd390c48ee40dd97f70403c6981dc951e
Closes-Bug: 1415169

commit_message:
Fixed _is_superdomain check in central

Previously this search term would match on the domain test so that
t.zone.fqdn. would be marked as a super domain of test.zone.fqdn.

This ensures the check only matches true super domains

Change-Id: I9e2b28b6dfbe7e1822b4ba5f96f96d2bb15ea248
Closes-Bug: 1423148

subject: Fixing race-condition for order processing in workers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-04 21:43:09.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/api/controllers/orders.py', 'barbican/tests/database_utils.py', 'barbican/tests/api/test_resources.py'], 'message': "Fixing race-condition for order processing in workers

Fixes issue where orders are processed by workers before the order has
been committed to the DB.

Because we're forcing a commit in the order controller, we also need to
setup an in-memory db for each test setup that calls against a order
resource.

Change-Id: Ib9366d2b48ba15b0d7bc9d5bf0da511a1b23acf4
Closes-Bug: 1428282
"}]
commit_message:
Fixing race-condition for order processing in workers

Fixes issue where orders are processed by workers before the order has
been committed to the DB.

Because we're forcing a commit in the order controller, we also need to
setup an in-memory db for each test setup that calls against a order
resource.

Change-Id: Ib9366d2b48ba15b0d7bc9d5bf0da511a1b23acf4
Closes-Bug: 1428282

subject: Creating indexes for foreign keys
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-04 23:43:35.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/model/migration/alembic_migrations/versions/1c0f328bfce0_fixing_composite_primary_keys_and_.py', 'barbican/model/models.py'], 'message': "Creating indexes for foreign keys

Foreign keys were set to primary_key=True which was creating composite
primary keys. These keys weren't useful and with large table sizes the
resulting performance was horrid. This fixes it by changing the primary
key constraint on foreign keys to an index. Additionally, the primary
key constraint implicitly made those columns not nullable. To preserve
this property, nullable has been set to False.

Change-Id: I4bfff872d50be9a57197a8009446c2159d4c4cdd
"}]
commit_message:
Creating indexes for foreign keys

Foreign keys were set to primary_key=True which was creating composite
primary keys. These keys weren't useful and with large table sizes the
resulting performance was horrid. This fixes it by changing the primary
key constraint on foreign keys to an index. Additionally, the primary
key constraint implicitly made those columns not nullable. To preserve
this property, nullable has been set to False.

Change-Id: I4bfff872d50be9a57197a8009446c2159d4c4cdd

subject: Add security group for neutron ports
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-05 13:03:08.000000000', 'files': ['samples/tasks/scenarios/heat/templates/server_with_ports.yaml.template', 'rally-jobs/extra/server_with_ports.yaml.template'], 'message': 'Add security group for neutron ports

During testing of scale heat rally test for neutron
(HeatStack.create_and_delete_stack) is falling because neutron
creates multiple security groups but nova cannot define which one
should it use. As a result nova cannot boot an instance.
The fix defines default security group in the
server_with_ports.yaml.template, so nova will choose
the one specific group.
In addition, the deprecated attribute network_id in the template
has been replaced with the network attribute.

Change-Id: I5e610f0fe3817fdbf6acd1e62ef7a5de3273874a
Closes-bug: #1428066
'}]
commit_message:
Add security group for neutron ports

During testing of scale heat rally test for neutron
(HeatStack.create_and_delete_stack) is falling because neutron
creates multiple security groups but nova cannot define which one
should it use. As a result nova cannot boot an instance.
The fix defines default security group in the
server_with_ports.yaml.template, so nova will choose
the one specific group.
In addition, the deprecated attribute network_id in the template
has been replaced with the network attribute.

Change-Id: I5e610f0fe3817fdbf6acd1e62ef7a5de3273874a
Closes-bug: #1428066

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2015-02-27 14:59:18.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/semver-support.rst'], 'message': 'Semver Utility for DB storage

Working with versions of various objects is a common problem, which already has
a number of market-adopted solutions. One of these solutions is Semantic
Versioning - a system of rules and requirements for assigning version numbers
to software components and other objects. One can find the specification for
SemVer freely at http://semver.org

It is proposed to add support of the semantic versioning concept into Glance,
so Glance objects (starting from Artifacts, but probably including Images in
future) may be properly versioned.

Change-Id: I72f7233f09ea36556fd46cab389988d1698eac37
'}]
commit_message:
Semver Utility for DB storage

Working with versions of various objects is a common problem, which already has
a number of market-adopted solutions. One of these solutions is Semantic
Versioning - a system of rules and requirements for assigning version numbers
to software components and other objects. One can find the specification for
SemVer freely at http://semver.org

It is proposed to add support of the semantic versioning concept into Glance,
so Glance objects (starting from Artifacts, but probably including Images in
future) may be properly versioned.

Change-Id: I72f7233f09ea36556fd46cab389988d1698eac37

commit_message:
Add extraroute contrib plugin

This change installs the extraroute contrib plugin for heat. It also
adds the plugin_dirs option to heat.conf, which defines
the locations where Heat plugins can be installed.

Change-Id: I940ed1c387ad5eaee5bcc80437f18dc742c662ec
Partial-Bug: #1420346

commit_message:
Remove old package python-netaddr-0.7.5

We do not need two version package python-netaddr
in ISO. Latest version packages will availble as
dependence of other packages.

Closes-Bug: #1387158

Change-Id: I43bffd9bfbfd6fa40f3d0d2d7c301ab3b3f847a3

subject: Allow for getting api versions from clouds.yaml
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2015-03-05 14:37:43.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/shell.py'], 'message': 'Allow for getting api versions from clouds.yaml

We process api version options a bit differently than other options, but
they are also things that might be set in a clouds.yaml or a
vendor.yaml about a cloud. Consume them also without the os_ prefix if
they exist.

Change-Id: Ic65eddde7237261ebfc168ec8b0731df0a20dcd1
'}]
commit_message:
Allow for getting api versions from clouds.yaml

We process api version options a bit differently than other options, but
they are also things that might be set in a clouds.yaml or a
vendor.yaml about a cloud. Consume them also without the os_ prefix if
they exist.

Change-Id: Ic65eddde7237261ebfc168ec8b0731df0a20dcd1

commit_message:
Allow additional nova.conf variables to be set

Add variables for the following 2 nova.conf vars:
image_cache_manager_interval (default 0)
remove_unused_resized_minimum_age_seconds (default 3600)

Change-Id: Ifa52ab226bfe695b64c32c94dd3ffccf465345a0
Closes-Bug: #1424808

commit_message:
New L23network implementation.

Squized 33 patchsets,
all changes detailed described in following blueprint.

Can't be merged without corresponded changes in Nailgun part.

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: I3d7bf070ef6fc42ef82c14f30780672084db5e71
Blueprint: refactor-l23-linux-bridges

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-02 09:37:51.000000000', 'files': ['nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': "Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for service_create

This patches remove the hard-code permission checks for db call
service_create.

There are elevated contexts in the code used to call service_create
aren't removed in this patch. The elevated context will be cleaned up
in last step. This is safe if we forget removing some hard-code
permission.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Change-Id: I1acc6473cd8899d01eb448467b7d1597e789957e
"}]
commit_message:
Remove db layer hard-code permission checks for service_create

This patches remove the hard-code permission checks for db call
service_create.

There are elevated contexts in the code used to call service_create
aren't removed in this patch. The elevated context will be cleaned up
in last step. This is safe if we forget removing some hard-code
permission.

Partially implements bp v3-api-policy

Change-Id: I1acc6473cd8899d01eb448467b7d1597e789957e

subject: WIP: add Saml2KeystoneUnscoped for K2K federation
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-04 15:11:06.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneclient/contrib/auth/v3/saml2.py'], 'message': "WIP: add Saml2KeystoneUnscoped for K2K federation

Implement the auth plugin noted for K2K federation.  The existing
Saml2ScopedToken plugin works for getting a scoped token.

This is marked WIP for 2 reasons:
1)  Unit tests (I'm working this)
2)  I wonder if this should merge in function defined in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/159022/
so that the API user doesn't have to get the SAML at all.
Instead this plugin could be enhanced to just accept a scoped token
for the IDP, could perform the samlization as well, and return the
unscoped token for the SP.

Change-Id: Ib8945163818834bf5d95559018fb948bc38be6b9
"}]
commit_message:
WIP: add Saml2KeystoneUnscoped for K2K federation

Implement the auth plugin noted for K2K federation.  The existing
Saml2ScopedToken plugin works for getting a scoped token.

This is marked WIP for 2 reasons:
1)  Unit tests (I'm working this)
2)  I wonder if this should merge in function defined in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/159022/
so that the API user doesn't have to get the SAML at all.
Instead this plugin could be enhanced to just accept a scoped token
for the IDP, could perform the samlization as well, and return the
unscoped token for the SP.

Change-Id: Ib8945163818834bf5d95559018fb948bc38be6b9

commit_message:
Set of small patches

* simplify res_factory due we don't use low level create_resource function more
* remove unnided code
* move ethtool mapping to external function
* FIX: check double-creating for subinterfaces and bridges
* FIX: MTU from bond properties didn't pass to bond slave interfaces
* FIX: when add 'mtu' setting to 'interface_properties' puppet fails
* FIX: endpoint can has empty body (translated to IP: none)
* FIX: endpoints section in network_scheme may be empty
* optimize generate_network_config() -- remove some unnided code

Blueprint: refactor-l23-linux-bridges
Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: Iadfc4ebef409bb6814970e31d1e4022c35bde5f6

Set of fixes

* ruby 1.8 backward compatibility fix
* more powerfull sorting bridge list for OVS and OVS2LNX patchcords
* some debug prints now represents data structures as YAML
* catch non-fatal exception while adding port to bridge
* pass transparently vendor_specific hash to all resources. pass use_ovs parameter to all runtime configuration resources.
* use use_ovs parameter
* MTU setting for bond interface (inherits by bond interfaces), (need for Centos6 and 12.04)

Blueprint: refactor-l23-linux-bridges
Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: Ie7430a96d41c2bcaf7376bd79d3a8669ca5a2f55

commit_message:
Add Puppet 4.x lint checks

This changes the puppet-lint requirement to 1.1.x, so that we can use
puppet-lint plugins. Most of these plugins are for 4.x compat, but some
just catch common errors.

Change-Id: If9f969703d99f3a45fd1822208a2b1342f13e49a

commit_message:
Linux bond resources management

* bond can be created/removed
* bond can contains ports (interface_properties)
* ports can add/remove to the bonds
* bond can contain and changes bond-properties
* bond can be a member of bridge
* bond is a persistent object

+ some bugfixex in old logic

Blueprint: refactor-l23-linux-bridges
Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: I4317abf027311aa8a4ebef5848cb7bf127a60e19

commit_message:
FIX prefetch functionality for l2_port resources

* Now puppet can determine OVS, LNX and LNX-inside-ovs interfaces.
* OVS interfaces are prefetch by his own provider
* LNX provider skip OVS resources if it possible

Blueprint: refactor-l23-linux-bridges
Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: I7508b6fa4d88d067d3f47ec191358e1fddfc5aad

commit_message:
Explicitly set overcloud stack timeout to lower value

Our overclouds seem to succeed in ~20mins. Decrease the overcloud
timeout to 35min so we dont have to hold up failed nodes a lot longer
than needed.

Change-Id: Iaa028db1b1245379c0875ba9ca1b0ef025a86835

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2015-03-05 14:36:01.000000000', 'files': ['utils/jenkins/fuel_logs.py'], 'message': 'Add fuel_logs tool

This tool can extract the useful lines from Astute and Puppet logs
within the Fuel log snapshot or on the live Fuel master node.

usage: fuel_logs [-h] [--astute] [--puppet] [--clear] [--sort] [--evals]
                 [--mcagent] [--less]
                 [SNAPSHOT [SNAPSHOT ...]]

positional arguments:
  SNAPSHOT       Take logs from these snapshots

optional arguments:
  -h, --help     show this help message and exit
  --astute, -a   Parse Astute log
  --puppet, -p   Parse Puppet logs
  --clear, -c    Clear the logs on the master node
  --sort, -s     Sort Puppet logs by date
  --evals, -e    Show Puppet evaltrace lines
  --mcagent, -m  Show Astute MCAgent calls debug
  --less, -l     Redirect data to the "less" pager

Using anywhere to view Fuel snapshot data:

fuel_logs.py fail_error_deploy_ha_vlan-2015_02_20__20_35_18.tar.gz

Using on the live Fuel Master node:

fuel_logs.py -a View the current Astute log
fuel_logs.py -p View the current Puppet logs

Using without -a and -p options assumes both options

fuel_logs.py -c Truncates Astute and Puppet logs. Respects -a and -p options.

It you are running and debugging many deployments on a single master node
you may want to truncate the logs from the previous deployments. Using -l
option is aslo recomended for interactive use.

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: Id6985625c07bd4751cdb214fba8ed4f9243f3591
'}]
commit_message:
Add fuel_logs tool

This tool can extract the useful lines from Astute and Puppet logs
within the Fuel log snapshot or on the live Fuel master node.

usage: fuel_logs [-h] [--astute] [--puppet] [--clear] [--sort] [--evals]
                 [--mcagent] [--less]
                 [SNAPSHOT [SNAPSHOT ...]]

positional arguments:
  SNAPSHOT       Take logs from these snapshots

optional arguments:
  -h, --help     show this help message and exit
  --astute, -a   Parse Astute log
  --puppet, -p   Parse Puppet logs
  --clear, -c    Clear the logs on the master node
  --sort, -s     Sort Puppet logs by date
  --evals, -e    Show Puppet evaltrace lines
  --mcagent, -m  Show Astute MCAgent calls debug
  --less, -l     Redirect data to the "less" pager

Using anywhere to view Fuel snapshot data:

fuel_logs.py fail_error_deploy_ha_vlan-2015_02_20__20_35_18.tar.gz

Using on the live Fuel Master node:

fuel_logs.py -a View the current Astute log
fuel_logs.py -p View the current Puppet logs

Using without -a and -p options assumes both options

fuel_logs.py -c Truncates Astute and Puppet logs. Respects -a and -p options.

It you are running and debugging many deployments on a single master node
you may want to truncate the logs from the previous deployments. Using -l
option is aslo recomended for interactive use.

Fuel-CI: disable
Change-Id: Id6985625c07bd4751cdb214fba8ed4f9243f3591

commit_message:
Add Service.get_by_host_and_binary and ServiceList.get_by_binary

This adds query methods that don't depend on CONF, but still allow us
to query for services by their function (binary instead of topic). It
also allows for code at other layers to do this without needing details
of the RPC layer.

Also added here is a convenience method to search for nova-compute
services specifically.

Change-Id: Iee2b652b352a40bc8fdaa0a7265de86a0bef3cc0

commit_message:
Modifying the default tempest config

* Adding snapshot to [compute-feature-enabled]
  * enables: test_list_images_filter_by_server_id
  * enables: test_list_images_filter_by_type
  * enables: test_list_images_filter_by_server_ref
  * enables: test_list_images_with_detail_filter_by_type
  * enables: test_list_images_with_detail_filter_by_server_ref
  * enables: class(ImagesTestJSON)
  * enables: tempest.api.compute.images.test_images_oneserver
* Adding resize to [compute-feature-enabled]
  * enables: test_resize_server_with_null_flavor
  * enables: test_resize_server_with_non_existent_flavor
  * enables: test_resize_server_confirm
  * enables: test_resize_server_revert
* Adding console_output to [compute-feature-enabled]
  * enables: test_get_console_output
* Adding api_v2 to [image-feature-enabled]
  * enables: tempest.api.image.v2.test_images
* Adding object_versioning to [object-storage-feature-enabled]
  * enables: tempest.api.object_storage.test_object_version

Closes-Bug: 1426442

Change-Id: I2a3c549a7c861d80c00e3779f6a585527e7a9fbd

commit_message:
Add behavior to enable ironic noauth mode

Added behavior to enable users to utilize the ironic functionality with noauth
mode set on the server side.  This logic is utilized if the auth_plugin is
defined as: None or "None" or ''. Bumped os-client-config requirement
because this working requires the pass-through support that got added
there in 0.5.0.

Change-Id: I3f8a9e0a9952be2d24c6cb655dfed9519134102e

commit_message:
Change queries for network services to use binary instead of topic

This makes nova/network bits use get_by_host_and_binary instead of
querying by RPC topic to locate nova-network services.

Change-Id: Id3e61440fab7f774dd62423b072c3c727b4ed853

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-03-04 20:23:39.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/dell/dell_storagecenter_api.py'], 'message': 'Dell SC API change fails snapshot creation

The Dell Storage Center driver is failing snapshot creation on
later versions of the Dell REST API.

The doNotExpire option was removed in API 15.3.1.110.  We were
setting this so that the replays are not expired and removed when
Cinder expects them to still be there.  This has been replaced by
setting expiretime to 0.  We were doing this already so the fix
was to simply remove doNotExpire from the REST request payload.

This will fail on every future release of the Dell Storage Center
so this is a critical fix.

Closes-Bug 1428259

Change-Id: I51fbf599e29e30793cdd1e6014e876d749732fd3
'}]
commit_message:
Dell SC API change fails snapshot creation

The Dell Storage Center driver is failing snapshot creation on
later versions of the Dell REST API.

The doNotExpire option was removed in API 15.3.1.110.  We were
setting this so that the replays are not expired and removed when
Cinder expects them to still be there.  This has been replaced by
setting expiretime to 0.  We were doing this already so the fix
was to simply remove doNotExpire from the REST request payload.

This will fail on every future release of the Dell Storage Center
so this is a critical fix.

Closes-Bug 1428259

Change-Id: I51fbf599e29e30793cdd1e6014e876d749732fd3

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-04 13:59:27.000000000', 'files': ['files/rpms/general'], 'message': 'Do not install the python-virtualenv on Fedora

The files/rpms/general:python-virtualenv explicitly
installed this package on Fedoras.

This package is not installed on other distros by devstack
by default.

If you stack/unstack the package gets reinstalled,
and confuses the system about the installed virtual-env version.
The uninstall works in CI, but it can be problematic when you do
reinstalls on the same machine.

The uninstall introduced by
834b804d3eda9029d3c66db0ab732a76a22ed08b, this commit deos not
has any reference to the external bug what it supposed to solve.

Related RDO thread started here:
https://www.redhat.com/archives/rdo-list/2015-March/msg00015.html

Change-Id: I4a723f179bdc28d39a4910fb9e3787e9e67c354b
'}]
commit_message:
Do not install the python-virtualenv on Fedora

The files/rpms/general:python-virtualenv explicitly
installed this package on Fedoras.

This package is not installed on other distros by devstack
by default.

If you stack/unstack the package gets reinstalled,
and confuses the system about the installed virtual-env version.
The uninstall works in CI, but it can be problematic when you do
reinstalls on the same machine.

The uninstall introduced by
834b804d3eda9029d3c66db0ab732a76a22ed08b, this commit deos not
has any reference to the external bug what it supposed to solve.

Related RDO thread started here:
https://www.redhat.com/archives/rdo-list/2015-March/msg00015.html

Change-Id: I4a723f179bdc28d39a4910fb9e3787e9e67c354b

commit_message:
Adds keypair type in nova-api

X509 certificates are used by Windows for passwordless
authentication (WinRM) in a way which can be considered
consistent with the usage of SSH keys on Linux, as both
are based on public / private keypairs.

Enables nova-api to return the keypair type, updates
nova-api version to reflect the changes and updates the
unit and functional tests to validate the API changes.

Unit tests have been updated to ensure that the keypair
type is not being returned on previous API versions.

Note: x509 keypair implementation is added in the next
commit.

DocImpact - See nova/api/openstack/rest_api_version_history.rst
for details

APIImpact

Depends-On: Id5b210d7afe5c0a590abcbd42b9ff85b071a5c55

Co-Authored-By: Chris Yeoh <cyeoh@au1.ibm.com>
Partially implements: blueprint keypair-x509-certificates

Change-Id: I215662f2f92a01921a866c3218031787a9eaf915

commit_message:
rest: replace list+filter by search mechanism

This replaces the current very-limited search by attribute by the full
complex query system we implemented in the indexer.

It's exposed instead as POST /v1/search/resource/<type>.

Change-Id: I18aa1984bb617c090345e1fa66ff0b30cdd74e66

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-05 12:26:10.000000000', 'files': ['fuelclient/fuelclient/client.py'], 'message': 'fuelclient: use keystone v2.0 client explicitly

Currently, we're using a Keystone client which actually performs
auto discovering and returns one of available client. In theory
all works fine, but unfortunately the "auth_url" will be replaced
by Keystone with a keystone endpoint. The issue is that this
endpoint may be unavailable if we're working through some
proxy/tunnel and don't have direct access to the fuel master node.

As workaround, we can explicitly create a keystone client for v2.0,
and none of discovering will be performed and the endpoint will not
be replaced implicitly by keystone client.

Change-Id: Ieada040739116227f53f70558cead5bcb4d5bb48
Closes-Bug: #1405190
(cherry picked from commit df4f1d9bcc6c9755fefb2654a13e817cf50ab7bd)
'}]
commit_message:
fuelclient: use keystone v2.0 client explicitly

Currently, we're using a Keystone client which actually performs
auto discovering and returns one of available client. In theory
all works fine, but unfortunately the "auth_url" will be replaced
by Keystone with a keystone endpoint. The issue is that this
endpoint may be unavailable if we're working through some
proxy/tunnel and don't have direct access to the fuel master node.

As workaround, we can explicitly create a keystone client for v2.0,
and none of discovering will be performed and the endpoint will not
be replaced implicitly by keystone client.

Change-Id: Ieada040739116227f53f70558cead5bcb4d5bb48
Closes-Bug: #1405190
(cherry picked from commit df4f1d9bcc6c9755fefb2654a13e817cf50ab7bd)

commit_message:
indexer: allow created_by_{user,project}_id to be null

This relaxes the limitation we set on the user and project that creates
the metric/resources to have a user/project. Actually, it should never
be null, but if someone wants to user Gnocchi without any kind of
authentication, it should be possible to do so entirely.

Change-Id: I6c7c2a86d4967e2f6e4faa8a03af9e2a49788d9e
Closes-Bug: #1424005

commit_message:
[Sahara] move cluster timeout from config to param

Configuring cluster creation timeout through the configuration file is
not flexible enough. So now the timeout can be confiured for each
scenario separately. The Sahara Cluster Context now also supports the
timeout as a parameter.

commit_message:
Handle project_name/tenant_name in the auth dict

We were doing backwards compat for project/tenant in a way that didn't
notice anything in the auth dict - which is there project/tenant info
goes. Ooops.

Change-Id: I141c1d99f31f381898bf993c4e7fcab1078f40c6

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-03 11:08:02.000000000', 'files': ['fuelmenu/fuelmenu/common/network.py', 'fuelmenu/fuelmenu/modules/interfaces.py'], 'message': "Update puppet for l23network in fuelmenu

L23network's l3 config has been refactored
and requires static IP configuration in
the format of ipaddr=IP/cidr instead of
ipaddr=IP, netmask=netmask

Added method to calculate cidr from a
given netmask to common.network class.

Blueprint: refactor-l23-linux-bridges
"}]
commit_message:
Update puppet for l23network in fuelmenu

L23network's l3 config has been refactored
and requires static IP configuration in
the format of ipaddr=IP/cidr instead of
ipaddr=IP, netmask=netmask

Added method to calculate cidr from a
given netmask to common.network class.

Change-Id: Ie5ca176e93efcd1b2ed88087f5a9e98078ab6701
Blueprint: refactor-l23-linux-bridges

commit_message:
Start ceilometer resource agents

 * Ceilometer agent central and ceilometer alarm evaluator
   now start as resource agents of pacemaker
 * Disable upstart for this two services

 It does not make sense to have started ceilometer-central-agent
 without coordination, also it does not make sense to have
 started ceilometer-alarm-evaluator more than one per claster.
 This is disoriented users only. So here we enabled
 this services via pacemaker. This change should be
 present in 6.0 too.

DocImpact

Change-Id: Ic15a3bfb6238e4281b06aae0a3f9fe4abf96590d
Closes-bug: #1418984
Closes-bug: #1422403

is used only for controlles but it's also required for compute nodes

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-05 11:29:20.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Pin flake8 and pep8 version

If falke8 and pep8 version will be allowed to update without control,
it would cause future patchsets to fail CI check when new rules
was added. It is a problem since we do not fix such things in stable
branches.

commit_message:
Pin flake8 and pep8 version

If falke8 and pep8 version will be allowed to update without control,
it would cause future patchsets to fail CI check when new rules
was added. It is a problem since we do not fix such things in stable
branches.

Closes-Bug: #1428587
Change-Id: I94709d8f310e93b2cee617f3e4a43a64d22916b5

commit_message:

Aligning partitions is recommended for Ceph. This change
also brings pmanager in line with how Fuel agent creates
partitions.

commit_message:
Refactor functional tests to clarify scoring

Explicitly state how many "info", "warn", and "error" results
are expected in each functional test.

Make each test a single call to a helper method, which reduces
copy-pasted code.

Finally, condense a few nearly-identical tests.

Change-Id: I55da22f59a140eaa27f97ad28c3ac18e2e65e555

commit_message:
Clean up test property decorators after refactor

This change removes several decorator functions that are deprecated
due to a refactor.

These functions are no longer used within the Bandit code base:
$ grep -r checks_ *
core/test_properties.py:        logger.debug('checks_decorator function executed')
core/test_properties.py:def checks_functions(func):
core/test_properties.py:def checks_calls(func):
core/test_properties.py:def checks_imports(func):
core/test_properties.py:def checks_strings(func):
core/test_properties.py:def checks_exec(func):

It also make a minor tweak to correct debug output.

Change-Id: I39549f05fdec238ad37376f9791af81929eb3a26

commit_message:
Fix an error on cloning kubenetes repo

By following the quickstart guide, the step of cloning the kubenetes
repo will fail. This is due to the target directory has already been
deployed. This patch removes the unnecessary repo cloning.

Change-Id: I919f0bd17112cf8238a3fc599f3991fd5c569999
Closes-Bug: 1426972

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2015-03-05 10:01:53.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_node_visitor.py', 'bandit/plugins/injection_sql.py', 'bandit/core/result_store.py', 'bandit/plugins/crypto_request_no_cert_validation.py', 'bandit/core/constants.py', 'bandit/core/node_visitor.py', 'bandit/plugins/secret_config_option.py', 'bandit/plugins/insecure_ssl_tls.py', 'bandit/core/manager.py', 'bandit/core/tester.py', 'bandit/plugins/exec_as_root.py', 'bandit/plugins/injection_shell.py', 'bandit/core/context.py'], 'message': 'Refactored AST processing

AST now Parses by statement.
- Added StatementBuffer class to manage statement processing.
- Fixed a bug with multi-line numbering, moved to statement object.
- Updated sql injection test to implement statement context knowledge POC.
- Added node_visitor unit tests
- Completed test_node_visitor StatementBuffer coverage
- Added docstrings
- Fixed a bug processing Try/Except constructs
- Fixed reporting to only display the affected line number
- Updated reporting to use dicts rather than tuples
- Changed the test runner to use a copy of the context, to allow per-test
  tweaks of some context values (i.e. lineno)
- Changed constants.FALSE_VALUES from a tuple to a list
- Updated context.check_call_arg_value(). Now takes two params,
  corrects the line number, and handles checking lists of values
- Updated various tests to use the updated functions
- Updated json output to provide line range as well as line number
- Added some comments to explain some of the more interesting functionality

Change-Id: I552c443fa434f25617f4fd281a0d78fb7a532e42
'}]
commit_message:
Refactored AST processing

AST now Parses by statement.
- Added StatementBuffer class to manage statement processing.
- Fixed a bug with multi-line numbering, moved to statement object.
- Updated sql injection test to implement statement context knowledge POC.
- Added node_visitor unit tests
- Completed test_node_visitor StatementBuffer coverage
- Added docstrings
- Fixed a bug processing Try/Except constructs
- Fixed reporting to only display the affected line number
- Updated reporting to use dicts rather than tuples
- Changed the test runner to use a copy of the context, to allow per-test
  tweaks of some context values (i.e. lineno)
- Changed constants.FALSE_VALUES from a tuple to a list
- Updated context.check_call_arg_value(). Now takes two params,
  corrects the line number, and handles checking lists of values
- Updated various tests to use the updated functions
- Updated json output to provide line range as well as line number
- Added some comments to explain some of the more interesting functionality

Change-Id: I552c443fa434f25617f4fd281a0d78fb7a532e42

commit_message:
Ensure admin role is assigned prior to creating floating range

Nova API will return a 403 if a non-admin user attempts to create
a floating IP range.

commit_message:
Add dependency on oslo-serialization for nailgun

Nailgun needs to use oslo jsonutils as a package instead of having it
hardcoded in its own repository.

There will be commits in nailgun that will migrate the code to use
oslo.serialization lib.

Change-Id: I3b042405b605c352a8169ea63b46ce7a38ed90b6
Related-Bug: #1400661

commit_message:
Replace jsonutils with oslo.serialization version

jsonutils is now in separate library, and the oslo.serialization will be
used from now on.

Change-Id: I28b6b70e437f154cf1b9ce0b15b0c3e716d170ee
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/158674/
Closes-Bug: #1400661

commit_message:
Fix incorrect parameters for Glance Members API

1. Remove duplicate member_id request parameter for Show/Update/Delete API.
2. Add response parameters for List/Create/Update/Show APIs.
3. Add status request parameter for Update API.
4. Add member_id request parameter for Create API.

Change-Id: Ib3273aa28389e8f1b7cf56d92b6a8f937a9dfa32
Closes-bug: #1426225

commit_message:
Remove SSH handling methods

  Move fuelweb_test.models.EnvironmentModel.get_admin_remote() method to
  fuel-devops.devops.models.Environment class
  Move fuelweb_test.models.EnvironmentModel.get_private_keys() method to
  fuel-devops.devops.models.Environment class
  Move fuelweb_test.models.EnvironmentModel.get_ssh_to_remote() method to
  fuel-devops.devops.models.Environment class
  Move fuelweb_test.models.EnvironmentModel.get_ssh_to_remote_by_key()
  method to fuel-devops.devops.models.Environment class
  Remove fuelweb_test.models.EnvironmentModel.get_ssh_to_remote_by_name(). Use
  fuel-devops.devops.models.Environment.get_ssh_to_remote() instead
  Remove fuelweb_test.models.EnvironmentModel._get_network(). Use
  fuel-devops.devops.models.Environment.get_network() instead
  Remove fuelweb_test.models.EnvironmentModel.get_net_mask(). Use
  fuel-devops.devops.models.Network.netmask instead
  Add fix for admin_net and admin_net2

Related to change: https://review.openstack.org/159375/
Change-Id: I30317f1a9520abf56866ad40a0325fa6010d7b65
Implements: blueprint system-tests-and-devops-refactoring

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-03-04 14:07:51.000000000', 'files': ['swiftclient/shell.py', 'tests/unit/test_service.py', 'tests/unit/test_swiftclient.py', 'swiftclient/utils.py', 'tests/unit/test_shell.py', 'swiftclient/service.py', 'tests/unit/utils.py'], 'message': "Add improvements to MD5 validation.

With MD5Sum checking being added, a concern was brought up that It was
a change with no possibility of reverting to the old behaviour.
This change adds the flag '--ignore-checksum' to the upload subcommand
allowing the checks to be turned off.

Changed occurrences of the magic string for a null md5 to use a descriptive
constant instead.

Updated Error messages generated when validation fails. They should now be more descriptive

Change-Id: Id1756cbb6700bb7e38f0ee0e75bc535e37f777ed
"}]
commit_message:
Add improvements to MD5 validation.

With MD5Sum checking being added, a concern was brought up that It was
a change with no possibility of reverting to the old behaviour.
This change adds the flag '--ignore-checksum' to the upload subcommand
allowing the checks to be turned off.

Changed occurrences of the magic string for a null md5 to use a descriptive
constant instead.

Updated Error messages generated when validation fails. They should now be more descriptive
and not output a literal newline sequence.

Change-Id: Id1756cbb6700bb7e38f0ee0e75bc535e37f777ed

commit_message:
Upgrade oslo.config to version 1.7

We will need the new version's cfg.list_all_sections method for a
patch that makes it possible to optionally use oslo.config based
configuration in Horizon: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/100521/

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2015-03-05 10:57:28.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Pin flake8 and pep8 version

If falke8 and pep8 version will be allowed to update without control,
it would cause future patchsets to fail CI check when new rules
was added. It is a problem since we do not fix such things in stable
branches.

Closes-Bug: #1428587
Change-Id: I94709d8f310e93b2cee617f3e4a43a64d22916b5
'}]
commit_message:
Pin flake8 and pep8 version

If falke8 and pep8 version will be allowed to update without control,
it would cause future patchsets to fail CI check when new rules
was added. It is a problem since we do not fix such things in stable
branches.

Closes-Bug: #1428587
Change-Id: I94709d8f310e93b2cee617f3e4a43a64d22916b5

commit_message:
Use name or ID of environment for murano CLI commands

This allows users to use the name or ID of an environment at the
command line for commands that take an environment ID, much the
same as other services, eg. nova, glance, etc.

Co-Authored-By: Ekaterina Chernova <efodorova@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I7a553a8df9d01ff1018c686aaa10d4b7d53c14e6
Closes-Bug: 1376048

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-03-03 07:07:08.000000000', 'files': ['virtualbox/functions/product.sh'], 'message': 'Slave nodes are not booted

We restart all the NICs of master node after we ensure Cobbler is
ready. Restarting NIC breaks network connection between Cobbler
and outgoing physical network. Added another restart of the docker
container after network restart.

Change-Id: I0bbba2fbad801e109f52ee5fbcf203b8ba7d1dd8
Closes-Bug: #1427227
'}]
commit_message:
Slave nodes are not booted

We restart all the NICs of master node after we ensure Cobbler is
ready. Restarting NIC breaks network connection between Cobbler
and outgoing physical network. Added another restart of the docker
container after network restart.

Change-Id: I0bbba2fbad801e109f52ee5fbcf203b8ba7d1dd8
Closes-Bug: #1427227

commit_message:
Apply event-log feature for Vanilla plugins

Applying event log feature for Vanilla 1.2.1 and Vanilla 2.6.0
plugins. We don't apply this feature for Vanilla 2.4.1, because
it's deprecated.

Change-Id: I0e9a097f389803a899fe238ccfe4889d32b8d9fe
Partially implements: blueprint event-log

Modify cinder api-paste.ini file on Kilo upgrade

commit_message:
Improved tox configuration

tox.ini is now similar to the one from Nailgun's code:
 * renamed 'pep8' env
 * added 'venv' env to run any command
 * replaced pep8 script with flake8
 * flake8 conf inside tox.ini
 * updated requirements for new tox.ini

Change-Id: I74c9b7f7bd137b6284e4e3dd5c131f348b564d78
Partial-Bug: #1404892
